turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: If you don't mind my asking, were you always the way you are?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What way is that?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: So... spontaneous.  All that leaping off buildings and Chinese fighting and whatnot.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: "Spontaneous."  I like that.  Most people say something like "hare- brained reckless son-of-a-bitch."

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Well... that, too.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nothing much to it really.  When I was younger I got into a pretty bad run-in with the Wyler Boys.  I saw them coming.  But I didn't act fast enough.  Second-guessed myself. And it cost me... cost me dearly.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: So... what happened?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Those kids, they took my wagon. Never got it back.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Uh... how long ago was this?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I was six.  And ever since, my policy is: Act first and worry later.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You might have mentioned you had that.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: I thought all you needed were your fists and your gun.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Strange... you'd think he'd have this place better guarded.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I find most criminals slip up somewhere...

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: They're so precious when they're asleep.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You really enjoy yourself, don't you?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Can you fill me in here?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sure.  We have no idea what's going on.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Come on, let's at least see if we can find Dr. Pemberton.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: You go ahead.  I'll stick with Loveless.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Know what this is?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sure.  It's a wind-up... thing.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: A cylinder recorder.  My own design.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: This is good.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Shhh!  Come on.  Tell us something!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Oh, damn!  That's it.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's better than nothing.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: It is?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: He's going to put on a pith helmet and kill some guy named Willard.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No record of him.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: You'd think if Loveless is going to kill him he could at least be a prominent citizen.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Sounds like a train.  Looks like a train.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Yes.  And a much nicer one than ours.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Willard...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: It's not a guy...

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: It's a town!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Got to be somewhere that's hot. He said it was "damnably hot."

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That rules out Willard, Vermont; Willard, Minnesota...  Willard, New Mexico?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Damn, I wish this thing would go faster.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Relax.  We're almost there.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: We oughta get a couple of those rockets.  Voom!  We're there before we left!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: This?  I'm testing a new spirit gum, to see how it holds.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And people are actually fooled by that?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: My disguises have helped me solve many a difficult case.  I spent three years on the stage, you know.  Remind me sometime to regale you with my Lear.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Not again.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: I adjusted it.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So the idea is if a guy punches me, he really hurts his hand?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: You said it popped out too easily. Nothing's ever good enough for you, is it?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: When we find him, he is mine.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Oh, no, we split him fifty-fifty.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: What if these tracks are just leading us to an Indian village or some old coot's mining claim?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Not likely.  There must be tracks of twenty different wagons.  Freight wagons, carriages, buckboards...

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Excellent detective work, sir.  You should have the honor of going first.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh, thank you.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: My pleasure.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Artemus, you ready for this?  His next target is Albuquerque.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: What?  President Grant is...!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I know!  I know!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: I don't have to tell you what that would do to our careers!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: We've got to stop him right here, now!  With that armored steam engine of his it'll be a slaughter.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: I'd love to stop him, but have you noticed the hundred armed men?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: There's only seventy-eight.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Oh, well, then let's kick some ass!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: It was in your book.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, hell, maybe we do have a chance.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Are those just button buttons or...?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Of course not.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: My hat is off to you, sir.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: God in heaven, what is that?!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That's... that's the criminal mind about to stomp our sorry butts!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: My God!  He's so excessive!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where have you been?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Pull the balloon right in front of him!  We'll board the damn thing!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Oh, I see, an easy plan!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: The machine was stopped!  It seemed like a perfect time to disable it! Why'd you have to throw it into full throttle?!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: He was going to shoot me!  Do you mind?!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: All right, all right... It'll be okay.  I mean, eventually it'll just run out of steam.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: In the next two minutes?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Artemus!  Look at that.  Brand spanking new.  She's a beauty, huh?  Let's get rolling.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: What is this?  A whole new train?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, sure.  Didn't you get your orders?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, we'll stay in touch... you know.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: I'm sure we will.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Terribly sorry.  I'm always sticking this where it doesn't belong.  Federal agents, ma'am.  We're rescuing a kidnap victim...

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: Yes, me!

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: You?  Dr. Pemberton?  Of course. How novel.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: You didn't tell us you had this on!

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: My Lord, he was telling the truth!

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: He calls it the Tarantula.

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: But it only has six legs.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: He's not giving up?

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Well, see, he had this little wagon when he was a kid...

turns.speaker: ARTEMUS
turns.text: Time for you to get off, Ma'am.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: Like hell!  I'll see it through! Ram the bastard!

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: A new friend?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: We'll see.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Anyone?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Here.  Mr. Tyler.  He claims a certain skill at handling firearms.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Wonderful!  Our new friend from the wild west.  Please...

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: I could get used to this, looking down on people.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: They don't even realize they should be frightened.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Well, let's help them with that. Take the legs.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: My name's Tyler.  Frank Tyler. Pleased to meet you, ma'am.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I get that feeling.  You know, Mr. Tyler, I'm the kind of woman who doesn't believe men are much more than a complete waste of time. But after spying you across the room, I'm tempted to suspend my disbelief, at least for the evening.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You know, ma'am, you remind me of a pearl-handled pistol I once owned. A beautiful thing to look at, but too hot to handle.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I don't recollect ever being compared to a pistol before.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Please do.  I'm a man who appreciates a good firearm.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, where I come from it kind of goes with the territory.  Texas.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: My... the wild west.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Well, sir, you are proving to be one of my more interesting guests.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Your guests, ma'am?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Yes, in a way.  I'm the Doctor's social secretary.  I handle his correspondence, send out the invitations, you know.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Oh, don't worry.  I've already overlooked the fact your name's not actually on our guest list.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, I owe you one, don't I?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: You most certainly do.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: You must excuse the Doctor.  No one has ever beaten him at his little game.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I don't like to lose, either.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Have you taken a wrong turn, Mr. Tyler?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You tell me.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I'm not so sure Dr. Loveless would like to find his social secretary dancing in the dark with an uninvited stranger.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Forgive me, but you don't strike me as the social secretary type.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Thank you.  But the truth is, I'm a single woman in a man's world. That leaves me very few choices, doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I suppose so.  But life can be hard for a man, too.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Just a little insurance... against the unexpected.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Would that include me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Oh, I would hope not.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: You've... done... this... before.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I've had some practice.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: She's perfectly safe.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Really?  Like General Garrison or didn't you hear all that shooting?

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: My.  It's gotten longer.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You bring the best out in a man.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: I try.  Please, if you promise to protect me, I'll testify against him. I'll give you an ironclad case.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You know, I really hate being toyed with before someone shoots me.

turns.speaker: CASSANDRA
turns.text: Fine, I'll stop.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Look, I'm Captain James West...

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Well, Captain, then the answer is your train is still here.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Your private train, sir.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Private train?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: That would be correct.  Orders from the President himself.  Trans- portation at your beck and call. No delays.  Although, the government's generosity takes me a tad by surprise, as well.

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Doyle's the name, sir.  Of the Connemara Doyles.  And there's not a man riding the rails who holds a candle to meself.  That having been said, sir, you're five minutes late so let's be on our way!  Your friend's already aboard.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: My friend?

turns.speaker: DOYLE
turns.text: Would you be thinking... ramming speed, sir?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I would, Mr. Doyle!  Are you game?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Don't try to bamboozle me, Colonel. Has another scientist been kidnapped or not?

turns.speaker: RICHARDS
turns.text: Well, yes sir.  A Professor Morton, but with just a little more time, sir, I can assure you a breakthrough on this case...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Listen, in two days I'm embarking on a tour of the western territories.  And I want to know at least one problem is being handled competently in my absence.

turns.speaker: RICHARDS
turns.text: Of course, sir, that's why I've assigned a new man.  And he's no ordinary Marshal.  He's quite sophisticated.  Three college degrees.  A master of disguise. Speaks French...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: French?

turns.speaker: RICHARDS
turns.text: Yes sir.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: French?  Damn it, I want my own man on this case.  Somebody I trust. Somebody who doesn't mind breaking up the furniture!

turns.speaker: RICHARDS
turns.text: Why surely, Mr. President, there must be some mistake.  I mean...

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: A mistake?  To assign this case to the man who blew up all the bridges on the Chattanooga River and single- handedly trapped Jackson's entire cavalry?  How is that a mistake?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Mr. President, good to see you again, sir.  Sorry about all that.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: That'll be all, boys.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Good work.  Really.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: This is Colonel Richards.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nice to finally meet you, sir.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: But what would anyone have to gain from all this...?  Unless it were a foreign power.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Exactly.  Any number of nations would love to cripple our scientific growth.  And what better way to tip the scales in their favor than by killing off the greatest minds this country has produced.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: We find ourselves at the dawn of the Golden Age of Science.  And it is the God-given destiny of this glorious nation to carry the torch that lights the way!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Nicely said, sir.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Part of some speech they wrote for this trip I'm taking.

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: Goddamnit!  What am I doing?  What's happened to all my cigars?  Colonel Richards here has had a dozen agents on these cases for over a year.  No arrests, no leads, no clues...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: And now the job's yours.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: ... well, of course you can.  Mr. President, what a surprise.  What brings you here?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: On my way to Denver...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Where'd he say he was going to do this?

turns.speaker: GRANT
turns.text: He didn't.  That's your job.  I'm taking you off that other case until you've nabbed this lunatic. Good luck.  Nice train.  But mine's nicer.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I admire a man with a sense of humor.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: When you're three and a half feet tall, sir, life turns you into a comedian whether you like it or not.... Come with me, won't you?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I must compliment you on Miss Thompson... an exceptionally charming assistant.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Thank you.  I confess to a preoccupation with acquiring precisely that which the world says I cannot have.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Very good, sir!  I think my guest might be a sharpshooter by trade.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: No, sir... just a businessman.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Really?  Must be a dangerous business.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I deal with some tough customers.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Sir... I believe you have only two barrels.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: How embarrassing.  Did I hold up three fingers?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Why don't we just cut this routine short?  Whatever you do to us, we're not going to talk.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Talk?  About what...?  Oh!  About who you are and all that?

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: ... And do give me some room, Voltaire.  You're breathing on my head!  I hate it when you breath on my head!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dr. Loveless?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're not that big.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Restrain yourself, Voltaire.  He's just the sort of coward who would shoot an unarmed giant.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Still alive.  Hmm.  I suppose that doesn't bode well for poor Bruno.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: He had a pressing engagement.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Philistine.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You got that right.  Now get up. We're walking out of here.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Has it penetrated that adrenaline- addled skull that you are surrounded by seventy-eight of my loyal followers?  You are in my domain!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Has it penetrated yours that I'm holding a gun on their leader?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: The U.S. is my jurisdiction.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Exactly!  You are on foreign soil. You are a representative of the occupying forces.  Or haven't you checked a map lately?!

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: These lands were taken by force from Mexico in the illegal War of American Aggression.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: That would be... the Mexican War?

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Call it what you like.  The point is, I was heir to that land, Mr. West.  It belonged to my beloved grandmother!  Now I intend to have it back.  My own country!

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: I've even printed my own currency.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: "Emperor Miguelito...?"

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: The first.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well, your highness, what makes you think we'll ever sign a treaty with you?

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Because I am holding all the western territories hostage, Mr. West!  A town a day will disappear!  Willard was merely a test run, a stroll in the park.  Next, I level all of Albuquerque!  Yes, that's right.  Only yesterday I learned what you undoubtedly already know: your own President will be there.  What an added bonus! The gods are shining on me!  After tomorrow every American citizen will rise up and demand I be given back my humble little empire!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: So, I'm the only one here who can tell the difference between an Emperor and a murderer?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Easy now.

turns.speaker: MIGUELITO
turns.text: Easy?  Easy?  On just what grounds should I take it easy!?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Dr. Pemberton?

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Gotta get the Doctor someplace safe.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: Who were they?  What do they want with me?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: We'll explain on the way.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: I only met him once, but that was enough.  For such a little man he had quite an oversized opinion of himself.  He offered me the "rare and unparalleled opportunity" to develop a new steam engine for him.  He claims to have some sort of factory in Texas, I believe. Said I could have the run of the place.  He had all sorts of specifications.  But when I questioned him closely, it became obvious he was just another mercenary businessman.  Both he and his partner had no real love of steam.  It's sad.  So few men do.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Who was this partner of his?

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: A Southern gentlemen.  I don't recall his name.  I suppose it's unkind of me to say it, but he had the most disconcerting glass eye.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: A glass eye?  That's who it was! One-Eyed Jack Garrison.  Otherwise known as General Garrison, Confederate Third Army.  I saw him at Dr. Loveless' party, but I couldn't place him.  He used to wear an eye-patch.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: For the moment.  But I fear not for long.  I'm of no use to him now.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: He... he's planning to kill us, isn't he?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: He's just full of plans that aren't gonna work out.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: This is something.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: It's a smelting retort.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Now it's a bomb.

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: It is?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: I beg your pardon?

turns.speaker: PEMBERTON
turns.text: You don't know what he's built?! Surely you don't think he kidnapped all those geniuses to have them make something as rudimentary as this.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: WALTERS
turns.text: They're coming.

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: When are they coming?

turns.speaker: WALTERS
turns.text: They're rounding up a posse.  Figure an hour?

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: In an hour they're gone!

turns.speaker: WALTERS
turns.text: Hey...!

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: You're not going to use it, are you?

turns.speaker: WALTERS
turns.text: Well, come on, that's half a dozen armed men...

turns.speaker: JIM
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: We're going into battle, little one.  Find a woman to take care of it.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: He thought you were a woman, Airk!

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: Madmartigan!  What did you do this time?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Nothing you wouldn't have done it my place!

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: I always knew you'd end up in a crow's cage.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Least I'm not down there herding sheep!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Airk!  Come on, Airk.  Lemme outa here.

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: Hey, remember?  You don't need my help, Madmartigan.  Little rabbit trap like this?  Come on!  I could open it for you, but I wouldn't wanna insult you!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Gimme a sword, Airk.  I'll win your war for you.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: You left me to die, friend.

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: You managed alright.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Is this what's left of your army?

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: It's you they're after, Madmarti- gan.  What did you do this time?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: They're not after me.  They want the baby.

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: You gonna be a hero, Madmartigan? I've lost half my men fighting Kael, and Bavmorda, and the Nock- maar army.  Now you and this Peck, and that magpie up in the rafters, are gonna take 'em on alone?

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Then come with us.

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: You're chasing a dream.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Just get me some horses.

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Out for a little ride in the coun- try, Airk?

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: Thought you might get lonely, Mad- martigan!

turns.speaker: MADMARTIGAN
turns.text: Thank you, friend.

turns.speaker: AIRK
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: Willow Ufgood.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Yes...?

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: I hope you are comfortable here, inside my kingdom...

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: You mean, you know who this baby belongs to?

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: She belongs to all of us.  She is the future queen and ruler of all kingdoms on earth.

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: No, Willow.  Your journey has just begun.  It has been foretold that this child shall bring about the downfall of Queen Bavmorda, whose evil powers have darkened our world.  Upon you depends this princess's life.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: CHERLINDREA
turns.text: You are the guardian, Willow.  You must take her to Tir Asleen.

turns.speaker: WILLOW
turns.text: What is Tir Asleen?
